key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse is not currently enrolled in any classes at Arizona State University (ASU), according to university officials.
Rittenhouse faced charges for killing two men and wounding a third during protests in Wisconsin in 2020, but was acquitted of all charges on Nov. 19.
During his trial, he claimed to have enrolled in nursing classes at ASU, though it was later clarified that he was taking virtual classes as a non-degree seeking student.
ASU officials clarified that Rittenhouse has not gone through the admissions process and is not enrolled in the Edson College of Nursing and Health Innovation.
Several student-led organizations at ASU have demanded the university take further action to withdraw Rittenhouse completely.
A petition is circulating and a rally is scheduled with demands including Rittenhouse's withdrawal and a stance against white supremacy from ASU officials.
A joint statement from four ASU student-led organizations labelled Rittenhouse as a 'white supremacist killer,' demanding ASU to deny his further enrollment.
These organizations accuse ASU of allowing 'fascist factions' to operate on campus and demand the administration to denounce white supremacy.
There is a mixed reaction among ASU students about the demands for Rittenhouse's removal.
Rittenhouse's lawyer was contacted for comment, but there has been no response.
